    Calculate life-table summary statistics

    LifetableSummary.Rd

    Calculates key life-table summary statistics from mortality rates and population numbers, remaining life expectancy at each age and the expected number of years of life lost to death from each cause.

    LifetableSummary(
  mort_data,
  pop_data,
  strat_vars = c("age_cat", "sex", "imd_quintile", "year", "condition"),
  label = NULL,
  two_arms = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    mort_data

    Data table - central rates of death in single years of age and period, stratified by cause. Cause-specific death rates are "mix", stratified by subgroups of "age", "sex", "imd_quintile" and "year".

    pop_data

    Data table - mid-year population sizes in single years of age and period. Counts must be in a variable named "N_pop".

    strat_vars

    Character vector - the variables by which to stratify the summary.

    label

    Character - the label to append to the calculated variables. Defaults to NULL.

    two_arms

    Logical - is there a control and treatment arm. Defaults to FALSE

    Value

    Returns a data table of the number of deaths and expected years of life lost by cause and subgroup.

    Details

    The function assumes that it is dealing with age and period in single years, so adjusting the size of the time interval is not given as an option. The open age interval is 90+.

    Examples

    
if (FALSE) {
LifetableSummary(mort_data, pop_data)
}
